item.title: Kubernetes Notes, Procedures, and Best Practices
item.description:
Key Concepts & Terminology

Term Meaning Practical Example
Cluster Group of machines running Kubernetes A production cluster with 3 master nodes and 5 worker nodes
Node A VM or physical machine in a cluster EC2 instance or bare-metal server
Pod Smallest deployable unit (one or more containers) A pod running a web app + sidecar proxy
Deployment Manages pods and replicas Ensures 3 replicas of a web app are running
Service Stable network endpoint for pods Load balancer for web pods
ConfigMap Non-sensitive configuration data App config values
Secret Sensitive data storage Database passwords
Namespace Virtual cluster within a cluster Separate environments (dev/stage/prod)
Ingress HTTP routing into services Domain-based routing to apps
PersistentVolume (PV) Storage resource in the cluster A disk in cloud provider
PersistentVolumeClaim (PVC) Request for storage A pod requests 10GB storage
StatefulSet For stateful applications Databases, Kafka, etc.
DaemonSet Runs one pod per node Node monitoring agent
